concept.title: Cache APIs
concept.shortdesc: The native client has two cache APIs, RegionService and Cache.

section.title: RegionService API

ul.li: Access to the standard query service for the cache, which sends queries to the servers. See Remote Querying and Continuous Querying.

section.p: You do not use instances of RegionService except for secure client applications with many users. See Creating Multiple Secure User Connections with RegionService.

section.title: Cache API
section.p: Use the Cache to manage your client caches. You have one Cache per client.
The Cache inherits RegionService and adds management of these client caching features:

ul.li: Subscription keepalive management for durable clients.
Access to the underlying distributed system.
RegionService creation for secure access by multiple users.
